ETYMOLOGY: From Anglo-Norman French 'tenaunce', from Old French 'tenir' (to hold), ultimately from Latin 'tenēre' (to hold). Related to 'tenant'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun, a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The occupation or holding of land or property by a tenant, usually under a lease or rental agreement.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 租用土地或房产的行为或状态；租借权。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The new law will protect tenants and clarify the terms of tenancy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 新法律将保护租户并明确租约条款。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun, a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The period of time for which a property is held or occupied by a tenant.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: During his long tenancy, he made several improvements to the apartment.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在他长期的租住期间，他对公寓进行了多处改善。

REGISTER: Legal, business, and general contexts when discussing rented property.
